Research Citation Tracker

- Single HTML file with inline CSS and JS only, no external dependencies.
- App tracks and organizes research citations with title, author(s), URL, notes, and tags.
- **Keyboard-first UX**: Tab-focusable inputs/buttons, Enter to add citation, Arrow keys navigate list, 'D' toggles dark mode, 'P' toggles print view, 'E' edits selected item, Delete removes.
- **Auto theme**: Detects prefers-color-scheme (dark/light), persists user choice in localStorage.
- **Main sections**: Header with search input, "Add Citation" form (collapsible), citation list (sortable by title/author/date added).
- **Add form fields**: Title (required), Authors (comma-separated), URL, Notes (textarea), Tags (comma-separated).
- Each citation displays as card: title/author bold, URL clickable (opens in new tab), tags as pills, expand/collapse notes.
- **Search**: Live filter by title/author/tags/notes, highlights matches.
- **Sort**: Click headers (Title/Author/Date) to toggle ascending/descending.
- **Persistence**: All data in localStorage as JSON array, auto-save on changes, load on init.
- **Print-friendly view**: Toggle button hides UI chrome, shows compact list (title/author/URL/tags only), CSS @media print optimizes (no backgrounds, black text).
- **Responsive**: Mobile-first CSS grid/flexbox, cards stack vertically on small screens (<768px).
- **Accessibility**: ARIA labels/roles (listbox for citations, button for actions), high contrast colors, focus-visible outlines, screen-reader friendly (announce add/edit/delete).
- **Data limits**: Cap at 500 citations, show warning at 450.
- **Export**: Button downloads JSON backup, "Clear All" with confirmation dialog.
- Clean minimal design: Sans-serif font, card shadows, subtle animations (fade-in on add).
- Test features: Add 3 citations, search/tag filter, sort, theme toggle, print preview (Ctrl+P), persistence after refresh.
